concept.title: Creating documents
concept.shortdesc: You can create a document by using the insert() or upsert() methods.

conbody.note: General Couchbase documentation on the upsert() methods:
conbody.p: Performing an insert succeeds only if no document with that name exists. In contrast, an upsert (see ) overwrites any existing matching document.

Output:Stored item OK OperationResult<RC=0x0, Key=u'document_name', CAS=0xb81d69a5125aaa13>If the document being inserted already exists, the client will raise a couchbase.exceptions.KeyExistsError. If your application simply wants to set the value ignoring whether it exists or not, use the upsert() method.
